result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Detainer placed at: Dodge Correctional Institution
Hearing on September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Disclose all prescriptions to the appropriate authorities.  All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no further law violations.  Defendant to make all court appearances.

11:26 AM Defendant Phillip M Pasholk by Zoom (video), in custody, with attorney Alexis Garuz.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court addresses initial appearance in 22CM949.
Defense acknowledges receipt of the criminal complaint, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Court sets bail.
Parties are waiting for the DNA results to be returned on 22CM949.
Defendant to appear by video for the next hearing if he is still in custody.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

08:37 AM Attorney Paul Crawford in court for Attorney Alexis Garuz.   Defendant Phillip M Pasholk did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court is inclined to adjourn the initial appearance to tag along with the defendant's other matter before the Trial Court.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
